subject: Technology
title: Interactive TV: Choose Your Own Story
description: One-minute skill: Interactive TV: Choose Your Own Story.

hook.text: Netflix's Bandersnatch let viewers choose the main character's decisions. The show had five possible endings.

buildup.text: Interactive TV turns passive viewers into active participants. You decide what happens next in the story.

discovery.text: Bandersnatch required 150 minutes of footage for a 90-minute experience. Most viewers only saw a fraction of the content.

twist.text: Interactive content is expensive to produce and most viewers prefer to relax passively. The format hasn't gone mainstream.

climax.text: Children's interactive shows have been more successful. Kids love choosing what happens. Adults mostly don't bother.

punchline.text: Interactive TV exists. Most people just want to sit back and be told a story.

quiz.question: Why hasn't interactive TV become mainstream?
options: It's expensive to produce and most viewers prefer passive watching
